a.title: Authentication of the prescription

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

a.title: A unique string generated by an EPS (Electronic Prescribing System) to uniquely identify a prescription; this unique code is needed for traceability. It might be used to register whether a prescription, and/or the maximum number of repeats, has already been dispensed. The identifier can consist of a root and an extension [ISO 21090:2011].

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck100.png)

a.title: The date and optionally the time the prescription was issued.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

a.title: Identification of the prescribing health professional

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td: A.1.3 Identification of the prescribing health professional

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck110.png)

a.title: The family name/surname/last name of the prescriber. This enables the prescriber to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck110.png)

a.title: The given name/ first name of the prescriber. This enables the prescriber to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck110.png)

a.title: The professional title of the prescribing health professional, which may be used to prove the authority of the prescriber.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck110.png)

a.title: Details for direct contact could be an email address and/or phone/fax number of the prescriber in order for the dispenser and/or patient to contact the prescriber. This might be necessary if problems arise with dosage, allergies, reimbursement etc.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck110.png)

a.title: This is the address of the hospital or the practice, etc. where the health professional normally works, meets patients and prescribes medication. Minimally, the country should be specified.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck110.png)

a.title: Digital signature or token as proof of the authenticity of the prescriber.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck100.png)

a.title: A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a health care provider [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the prescriber and to check whether a medicinal product was prescribed by the right person according to the law of the prescribing country.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck10.png)

a.title: Identification of the prescribed product

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td: A1.4 Identification of the prescribed product

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck01.png)

a.title: Prescription information

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: Total quantity or volume of the medicinal product that is prescribed to the specific patient. It can be provided as number of packages, given that the pack size is sufficiently described, or it can be the overall amount in appropriate units of measure (UCUM) or units of presentation (EDQM) (ml, g, tablets, vials). Depending on national legislation, this quantity may or may not be dispensed in one dispensation.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td:
A.1.5.2 Quantity of prescribed product
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): UCUM, EDQM

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck011.png)

a.title: The regimen governing the dose quantity per single administration, the dose frequency, and/or speed of administration (in the event of intravenous administration). Note: this information may be used by the dispenser to calculate the quantity to be dispensed.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck0110.png)

a.title: The number of units per intake that the patient is taking. Example: 1 tablet

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td:
A.1.5.3.1 Number of units per intake
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): UCUM, EDQM

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck0100.png)

a.title: Frequency of intakes per hour/day/week/month. Example: every 24 hours. Preferred codesystems UCUM, HL7 TimingEvent

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: The route of administration as prescribed. Example: oral intake

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td:
A.1.5.4 Route of administration
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): EDQM

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: The duration of the treatment as indicated by the Prescriber. Example: 14 days. Can be left blank for long-term therapies.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td:
A.1.5.5 Duration of treatment
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): UCUM

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: The time and date on which it is agreed that therapy will start. - Preferred system(s): ISO 8601

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px
vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: Information about the directions for use of the prescribed medicinal product (such as ?with food? or ?before a meal?) and any cautionary advice for correct use of the prescribed medicinal product by the patient.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td:
A.1.5.7 Directions for use
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): HL7 TimingEvent

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: #F7F7F7

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: This might be dependent on local or national policy or legislation, in accordance with the treatment plan or because the therapeutic need for the prescribed medicine has expired.

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: In some countries, when medicinal products are dispensed for the first time, the patient may only receive medication for a short period of time. When a patient starts taking medication for a chronic illness, the prescriber can issue a prescription for a longer period that is now separated by repeats. In addition, the maximum quantity (A.1.4.3) of the prescribed product that may be dispensed in one dispensation may be stated here. Decision on dispensability is made in the country of prescription.

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck010.png)

a.title: The reason why the medicine is being prescribed, including the option to mention that the medicinal product is being prescribed for ?off label? use. The reason for the prescription gives the dispenser the opportunity to review the prescription for medication safety issues. Note: in some countries it is obligatory to state the reason for prescription on the prescription itself for some or all medicinal products.

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: Prescription. Several Sections of the eHN guideline.

copyright.value: Used by permission of HL7 Europe, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

definition.value: Prescription. Several Sections of the eHN guideline.
Patient administrative data
Authentication of the prescription

A unique string generated by an EPS (Electronic Prescribing System) to uniquely identify a prescription; this unique code is needed for traceability. It might be used to register whether a prescription, and/or the maximum number of repeats, has already been dispensed. The identifier can consist of a root and an extension [ISO 21090:2011].
The date and optionally the time the prescription was issued.

short.value: A.1.3 Identification of the prescribing health professional

definition.value: Identification of the prescribing health professional
The family name/surname/last name of the prescriber. This enables the prescriber to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.
The given name/ first name of the prescriber. This enables the prescriber to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.
The professional title of the prescribing health professional, which may be used to prove the authority of the prescriber.

Details for direct contact could be an email address and/or phone/fax number of the prescriber in order for the dispenser and/or patient to contact the prescriber. This might be necessary if problems arise with dosage, allergies, reimbursement etc.
This is the address of the hospital or the practice, etc. where the health professional normally works, meets patients and prescribes medication. Minimally, the country should be specified.
Digital signature or token as proof of the authenticity of the prescriber.

A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a health care provider [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the prescriber and to check whether a medicinal product was prescribed by the right person according to the law of the prescribing country.

short.value: A1.4 Identification of the prescribed product

definition.value: Identification of the prescribed product
Prescription information

Total quantity or volume of the medicinal product that is prescribed to the specific patient. It can be provided as number of packages, given that the pack size is sufficiently described, or it can be the overall amount in appropriate units of measure (UCUM) or units of presentation (EDQM) (ml, g, tablets, vials). Depending on national legislation, this quantity may or may not be dispensed in one dispensation.

The regimen governing the dose quantity per single administration, the dose frequency, and/or speed of administration (in the event of intravenous administration). Note: this information may be used by the dispenser to calculate the quantity to be dispensed.

short.value: A.1.5.3.1 Number of units per intake

definition.value: The number of units per intake that the patient is taking. Example: 1 tablet
Frequency of intakes per hour/day/week/month. Example: every 24 hours. Preferred codesystems UCUM, HL7 TimingEvent
The route of administration as prescribed. Example: oral intake
The duration of the treatment as indicated by the Prescriber. Example: 14 days. Can be left blank for long-term therapies.
The time and date on which it is agreed that therapy will start. - Preferred system(s): ISO 8601

Information about the directions for use of the prescribed medicinal product (such as ?with food? or ?before a meal?) and any cautionary advice for correct use of the prescribed medicinal product by the patient.
This might be dependent on local or national policy or legislation, in accordance with the treatment plan or because the therapeutic need for the prescribed medicine has expired.

In some countries, when medicinal products are dispensed for the first time, the patient may only receive medication for a short period of time. When a patient starts taking medication for a chronic illness, the prescriber can issue a prescription for a longer period that is now separated by repeats. In addition, the maximum quantity (A.1.4.3) of the prescribed product that may be dispensed in one dispensation may be stated here. Decision on dispensability is made in the country of prescription.

The reason why the medicine is being prescribed, including the option to mention that the medicinal product is being prescribed for ?off label? use. The reason for the prescription gives the dispenser the opportunity to review the prescription for medication safety issues. Note: in some countries it is obligatory to state the reason for prescription on the prescription itself for some or all medicinal products.
Substitution handling can be recorded to indicate whether and to what extent substitution is allowed by the prescriber.
Prescription. Several Sections of the eHN guideline.
Patient administrative data
Authentication of the prescription

A unique string generated by an EPS (Electronic Prescribing System) to uniquely identify a prescription; this unique code is needed for traceability. It might be used to register whether a prescription, and/or the maximum number of repeats, has already been dispensed. The identifier can consist of a root and an extension [ISO 21090:2011].
The date and optionally the time the prescription was issued.

short.value: A.1.3 Identification of the prescribing health professional

definition.value: Identification of the prescribing health professional
The family name/surname/last name of the prescriber. This enables the prescriber to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.
The given name/ first name of the prescriber. This enables the prescriber to be traced in the event of questions or emergencies.
The professional title of the prescribing health professional, which may be used to prove the authority of the prescriber.

Details for direct contact could be an email address and/or phone/fax number of the prescriber in order for the dispenser and/or patient to contact the prescriber. This might be necessary if problems arise with dosage, allergies, reimbursement etc.
This is the address of the hospital or the practice, etc. where the health professional normally works, meets patients and prescribes medication. Minimally, the country should be specified.
Digital signature or token as proof of the authenticity of the prescriber.

A unique number or code issued for the purpose of identifying a health care provider [ISO/TS 27527:2010]; this may be a licence or registration number which can be used to trace the prescriber and to check whether a medicinal product was prescribed by the right person according to the law of the prescribing country.

short.value: A1.4 Identification of the prescribed product

definition.value: Identification of the prescribed product
Prescription information

Total quantity or volume of the medicinal product that is prescribed to the specific patient. It can be provided as number of packages, given that the pack size is sufficiently described, or it can be the overall amount in appropriate units of measure (UCUM) or units of presentation (EDQM) (ml, g, tablets, vials). Depending on national legislation, this quantity may or may not be dispensed in one dispensation.

The regimen governing the dose quantity per single administration, the dose frequency, and/or speed of administration (in the event of intravenous administration). Note: this information may be used by the dispenser to calculate the quantity to be dispensed.

short.value: A.1.5.3.1 Number of units per intake

definition.value: The number of units per intake that the patient is taking. Example: 1 tablet
Frequency of intakes per hour/day/week/month. Example: every 24 hours. Preferred codesystems UCUM, HL7 TimingEvent
The route of administration as prescribed. Example: oral intake
The duration of the treatment as indicated by the Prescriber. Example: 14 days. Can be left blank for long-term therapies.
The time and date on which it is agreed that therapy will start. - Preferred system(s): ISO 8601

Information about the directions for use of the prescribed medicinal product (such as ?with food? or ?before a meal?) and any cautionary advice for correct use of the prescribed medicinal product by the patient.
This might be dependent on local or national policy or legislation, in accordance with the treatment plan or because the therapeutic need for the prescribed medicine has expired.

In some countries, when medicinal products are dispensed for the first time, the patient may only receive medication for a short period of time. When a patient starts taking medication for a chronic illness, the prescriber can issue a prescription for a longer period that is now separated by repeats. In addition, the maximum quantity (A.1.4.3) of the prescribed product that may be dispensed in one dispensation may be stated here. Decision on dispensability is made in the country of prescription.

The reason why the medicine is being prescribed, including the option to mention that the medicinal product is being prescribed for ?off label? use. The reason for the prescription gives the dispenser the opportunity to review the prescription for medication safety issues. Note: in some countries it is obligatory to state the reason for prescription on the prescription itself for some or all medicinal products.
Substitution handling can be recorded to indicate whether and to what extent substitution is allowed by the prescriber.
